isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOORS

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para: Doors are of all steel-welded construction. The cab door is mounted on hinges located on the cab hinge pillar and door adjustment is provided by enlarged holes in cab door hinge. Door check stop is located just below upper hinge on the cab door hinge pillar. Cab door latch striker pin is also adjustable on cab door lock pillar. Service on the door and its components is covered in sections which follow.
Refer to Figure 25 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove door wiring harness rubber boot (Item 1) from the cab hinge pillar (Item 2), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Door Wiring Harness Rubber Boot

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach up under the instrument panel to the left of the steering wheel an locate wiring harness coming from the door, pull cab door wiring harness (Item 1) down to access connectors (Item 2), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Door Wiring Harness and Connectors

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 27 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once access to the connectors is accomplished, disconnect CB radio cable connector (Item 1), electric window and electric door lock wiring harness connector (Item 2) and lighted, heated or electric mirror wiring harness connector (Item 3), if so equipped, driver side shown.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK CONNECTOR
3. LIGHTED, HEATED OR ELECTRIC MIRROR CONNECTOR

step1.para: Use a sling or padded chain through top of window opening and attach sling to an overhead hoist to support cab door.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 28 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cab door check stop pin (Item 1) from cab door check link (Item 2) and cab door check bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.
Remove four hex nuts with washers (Item 4) from threaded studs (Item 5) of cab door (Item 6), driver side shown.
Slide four threaded studs (Item 5) of cab door (Item 6) out of upper and lower cab door hinges (Items 7 and 8), driver side shown.
Carefully pull the wiring harness and connectors of cab door (Item 6) through cab door hinge pillar.
Using overhead hoist move cab door (Item 6) to a padded work bench, or cover with a material that will not scratch painted surfaces of the door a work bench or other suitable support.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door.
